primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God judges His people for their idolatry by sending them into exile, but subsequently acts unilaterally to redeem them and reveal His universal sovereignty through their suffering.

tekstueel_bewijs: I will hurl you out of this land
I, even I, am he who blots out your transgressions
the Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all

object.identificatie: Redemption and the restoration of the people as a 'light to the nations'
tekstueel_bewijs: Israel will become a light to the nations
God’s universal purpose for all the peoples of the earth

zender.identificatie: God as the Holy One of Israel
tekstueel_bewijs: I am the Lord, and there is no other

ontvanger.identificatie: The exiled people (Israel) and by extension the 'strangers on the earth' (the congregation)
tekstueel_bewijs: Fear not, for I have redeemed you... you are mine
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (the one in exile/suffering).

helper.identificatie: The Prophets (Jeremiah, Second Isaiah) and the Suffering Servant
tekstueel_bewijs: the prophet describes the Suffering Servant of the Lord
the voice we hear is the voice of God
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who provides the Helper (the Servant).
helper.rol_van_geest: External help through the 'searing Word of God'.

tegenstander.identificatie: False gods/Idols and the 'Heedless Optimism' of the people
tekstueel_bewijs: the gods of this world... they cannot save
heedless optimism, self-satisfaction, feelings of invulnerability
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a bad habit but 'worthless' gods that demand allegiance but cannot deliver from death or exile.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The faithful remnant (Daniel/Ezekiel) refusing to bow to idols and confessing sins.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Faithful Remnant
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human response of prayer and fasting is a result of the 'theological emergency' created by God's judgment, but the ultimate redemption is God's 'new thing'.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has accepted the tears and prayers
the Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we refuse to play the games
you and I have never known anything like what they went through

voorbeelden: If you don’t repent... you are going to have to serve false gods
Nobody wants to hear what the second group has to say
They knew they did not deserve God’s help
The real problem is that they cannot save

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Inability' (non-pouvoir) of idols and humans, contrasted with the 'Sovereign Power' (Pouvoir) of God to save.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From ~S1 (Optimism) to S2 (Exile) to ~S2 (Suffering Servant) to S1 (Redemption).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God resolves the tension by taking the 'iniquity of us all' upon the Servant, transforming S2 into a path to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; exile is described as a 'theological emergency' and a 'catastrophe'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It posits God as the primary actor who both judges and saves. Human action is relegated to either 'heedless optimism' (sin) or 'waiting/weeping' (reception).

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We are like Daniel and his friends... they infuriated Nebuchadnezzar by setting themselves apart

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: I, even I, am he who blots out your transgressions for my own sake
The real problem is that they [idols] cannot save. They have no power.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Daniel and the exiles are used as models of prayer and fasting, but they are immediately superseded by the 'Unknown Prophet' through whom God speaks unilaterally.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this: the focus is not on Daniel's strength but on God's 'audacious theology' emerging from defeat.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Comfort and relief; the burden of 'saving the world' or 'saving oneself' is removed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God's love is the cause, not the result, of human worth.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'theological emergency' of judgment to the 'new thing' of grace is perfectly handled.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Word of God acts as the agent of change rather than a specific mention of the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin leads to total cultural and spiritual collapse (Exile).

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by God's speech and action. The hearer is placed in the position of the 'exile' who receives a promise they did not earn.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Devoir' (Must) trap.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (idolatry/Babylon) is already depicted as a cosmic, crushing force.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's return) correctly precedes and enables the 'light to the nations' (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in grace-oriented preaching. It uses the 'Exile' as a heavy enough 'Opponent' that only a 'God-Subject' can overcome.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the Salisbury Town Hall metaphor; Greimas analysis shows that the metaphor serves to establish the Hearer as a 'Receiver' of a disaster they cannot fix.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains what happened in 587 BC; semiotics shows how the preacher uses that history to re-code the hearer's current suffering as 'Redemptive Suffering'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Suffering Servant' is the 'Helper' that allows God (Subject) to reach the Exiles (Receiver) without violating His role as Judge (Sender).

volledige_object_lijst: The city which is to come
appendices.notities: The sermon follows Fleming Rutledge's grammar of grace almost perfectly.
